history.content:
In my opinion, and from what I've read online/heard from other students, Stats is more "useful" when it comes to ML/AI. ML/AI is heavily rooted in probability and statistical/data analysis, so classes like 133, 134, 135, 151A, and 154 (I don't know how much overlap, if any, there is between 189 and 154) would provide you with a strong foundation in probability theory and data/stat analysis. 

Again, this is just my opinion. Physics of course is a vastly useful and very interesting field, but if you had to choose one of the two, I'd go with Stats.

I'm a sophomore, intended CS major. I would like to hear others' opinions on whether physics or stats is more helpful in terms of ML/AI research. I was planning to take PHY5B and STAT135 this semester, but now I think I have to drop one of them. Stats is probably more directly related to ML/AI research (and I've heard the professor for stats135 is legendary), but I remember Prof. Sahai said that we can pick up stats knowledge in grad school. On the other hand, I think physics can help us to build strong intuition in various other fields. 

Which one of the two would you suggest me to take this semester?
history.subject: Advice on physics or stats courses
